headline: Ya-Chieh Lai Memorial Scholarship Honors Innovator and SPIE Member in the Semiconductor Industry
summary: BELLINGHAM, Wash., February 19, 2026--SPIE, the international society of optics and photonics, Cadence Design Systems, Inc., and the Cadence Giving Foundation have partnered to jointly fund the Ya-Chieh Lai Memorial Scholarship. Starting in 2027 and spanning five years, the annual $10,000 scholarship will be awarded to a university student during the SPIE Design Technology Co-Optimization (DTCO) conference at Advanced Lithography + Patterning, the cornerstone event for the semiconductor industry

headline: CNBC Daily Open: Private credit fears and U.S.-Iran tensions pressure Wall Street
summary: Meanwhile, Blue Owl Capital tightened investor liquidity after selling $1.4 billion in loan assets, raising alarms about stability in the private credit market.

headline: Cadence ChipStack AI Super Agent Launch Meets High Valuation Watchpoints
summary: Cadence Design Systems (NasdaqGS:CDNS) has launched its ChipStack AI Super Agent, a new agentic AI tool for semiconductor design and verification. The company is also expanding AI driven collaborations with industry partners, including major foundries. The announcement highlights a push to automate more of the chip development workflow for engineers. Cadence is best known for its electronic design automation tools, which sit at the core of how chips are planned, designed, and tested. With...

headline: Bank of America Securities Remains Bullish on Cadence Design Systems, Inc. (CDNS)
summary: Cadence Design Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:CDNS) is among the most profitable software stocks to buy now. On February 10, Vivek Arya, an analyst at Bank of America Securities, reaffirmed a Buy rating on Cadence Design Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:CDNS), while setting a price target of $400. This translates to an upside potential of approximately 34%. On the […]

headline: Nasdaq Settles Higher As Tech Stocks Rebound: Investor Sentiment Improves, Greed Index Remains In 'Fear' Zone
summary: U.S. stocks gained as tech sector recovered and investors digested Fed meeting minutes. Fear & Greed index showed some easing at 40.3.
